page.title: 14CHANGES IN NORTHOLT/HARROW
page.content: The oldest building we investigated was Welldon Park School, built 1910. South Harrow was then farmland. The school was a combined infant and junior school. At its largest it contained 600 children, now it is a middle school with only 200 children and is completely surrounded by houses and shops. We interviewed 10 people in depth, out of these 8 had lived 10 years or more in the area, the longest for 49 yrs., another couple for 46 yrs.The earliest buildings were houses and a pub,the Eastcote Arms,then shops and more houses,then in the last 10 yrs., maisonettes and flats predominate. There is only a small area of wasteland left near the railway.Now a common activity is the{public planting {of trees}and the private renewal of windows,doors and roof.
